description.narrative: The project objective is to enhance the sustainability of protected areas in globally important desert and semi-desert ecosystems
independent political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Community involvement in conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity in and around PAs is enhanced
Number of PES agreements under implementation in project area

comment.narrative: 2 by project end

0
To implement the payments for ecosystem services PES mechanism the following work stages were identified
1 identification of ecosystem services determinations of key providers and consumers of ecosystem services 2015
2 economic assessment of ecosystem services 2016
3 holding negotiations with consumers of ecosystem services development of PES Agreements and signing contracts with consumers of ecosystem services 20162017
During the reporting period works on identification of ecosystem services in the IleBalkhash and AralSyrdaria project areas were conducted
Providers and consumers of ecosystem services were identified A map of ecosystem services is being elaborated

description.narrative: Share of registered land users and lowincome rural households benefiting from biodiversity microcredit line

comment.narrative:
2
As part of the completed socioeconomic studies 48 households with a low level of income were identified in the project areas
730 registered land users located near pilot PAs were identified
16 registered land users 2 in three project areas already obtained access to the projects microcredit funds through a Microcredit program EcoDamu which is administered by the Financing Fund for Agricultural Support FFAS

description.narrative: Number of hectares of riparian saksaul forests under sustainable management

comment.narrative: 0 ha

1500 ha
For the reporting period the state of saxaul and tugai forests was assessed ways of conservation and restoration of such forests were identified
To restore saxaul forests in the AralSyrdaria region a project on establishment of forest nursery for saxaul and other hardyshrub species is being implemented As a result for the reporting period 1500 ha of saxaul were planted in the Aral pilot area
In the IleBalkhash region a pilot project on conservation of the relict Asiatic poplar turanga small woods covering an area of 1800 ha is being implemented

1500 ha

description.narrative: Presence of plant species which negatively affect the function of distant rangelands

comment.narrative:
Hectares of distant rangelands with significant signs of natural succession due to under grazing1
1 Same as previous footnote
Unwanted plant species in at least 4 rangeland monitoring plots are less than 5 surface coverage

Initial indicators of unwanted plant species bitterling peganum coverage were identified in selected monitoring pasture plots
Nausha Bulak pasture plot 5000 ha the area covered by unwanted plants at the beginning of pilot project implementation comprise 750 ha or 15 of total area
Dala Karatay plot 6000 ha initial indicator of unwanted plants is 550 ha or 91 of total area
The quality indicator variability will be assessed after the achievement of envisage outcomes of the pilot projects

description.narrative: Quality and quantity of vegetation cover in rangelands in 3 rural districts

comment.narrative:
Hectares of land with significant signs of soil erosion caused by overgrazing in selected plots1
1 Baseline to be estimated at the beginning of the project once monitoring sites are identified and primary data are collected
Reduction of the size of the area heavily affected by soil erosion by at least 15 in the Ile Balkhash area and 20 in the Aral Syrdarya target area

The Project implements pilot projects in two rural areas Total area of degraded pastures is 11 000 ha Activities are being implemented to improve their quality and demonstrate sustainable distantpasture cattle rearing practices Monitoring sites were selected and initial indicators of the land degradation factor were identified in pasture plots Dala Karatay and Nausha Bulak
Nausha Bulak 5000 ha the land degradation factor is 30 of total monitoring area
Dala Karatay 6000 ha the land degradation factor is 35 of total monitoring area
The quality indicator variability will be assessed after the achievement of envisaged outcomes of the pilot projects
Reduction of the size of the area heavily affected by soil erosion by at least 15 in the Ile Balkhash area and 20 in the Aral Syrdarya target area

The Project implements pilot projects in two rural areas Total area of degraded pastures is 11 000 ha Activities are being implemented to improve their quality and demonstrate sustainable distantpasture cattle rearing practices Monitoring sites were selected and initial indicators of the land degradation factor were identified in pasture plots Dala Karatay and Nausha Bulak
Nausha Bulak 5000 ha the land degradation factor is 30 of total monitoring area
Dala Karatay 6000 ha the land degradation factor is 35 of total monitoring area
The quality indicator variability will be assessed after the achievement of envisaged outcomes of the pilot projects

description.narrative: Number of farmer associations that use the experiences of this project as a model

comment.narrative: No projects which use participatory bottomup approaches in the target areas
At least 15 farmer associations or rural consumer cooperatives in the Aral Syrdarya target area and 25 in the Ile Balkhash area use the experience of this project as a model

More than 20 farms in the AralSyrdaria and IleBalkhash project areas as well as local authorities NGOs scientific institutions are informed on the options and benefits of green technology application in the irrigated agriculture and distantpasture cattle rearing
As a result support was granted for implementation demonstration and replication of recommended approaches by already 3 farms

description.narrative: To enhance the sustainability of protected areas in globally important desert and semidesert ecosystems by expanding their geographic coverage promoting a landscape approach and supporting biodiversitycompatible livelihoods in and around PAs
Coverage of underrepresented Southern desert in the PA System of Kazakhstan

comment.narrative: 1591800 ha 53 of ecological zone

By 2015 coverage of Southern desert in PA system increases by 2682032 ha 89 of the ecological zone This increase comes from the following
Establishment of 1 new PA Mangistau State Reserved Zone covering 2676262 ha
Expansion of 1 existing PA Barsakelmes State Nature Reserve by 5770 ha
By 2020 coverage of Southern desert in PA system increases by approximately 970000 ha 32 of the ecological zone This increase comes from
Expansion of 1 existing PA Ustyurt State Nature Reserve by approximately 220000 ha
Establishment of a wildlife corridor between Barsakelmes and Ustyurt PAs of approximately 750000 ha

1591800 ha 53 of ecological zone as in the baseline
The following activities have been initiatedcompleted by the project to ensure the achievement of the EoP target
Plan of land boundaries allotment for establishment of Mangistau protected area of total area 2600000 ha is being approved by local government akimat of Mangistau Oblast
Works on approval of land use design and feasibility study TEO to expand Barsakelmes reserves area at local government akimat level of Kyzylorda Oblast were performed
dialogue platform was created to openly discuss issues related to adding 23000 ha of the Syrdaria river delta to the Barsakelmes reserve
scientific background report ENO for expansion of the Ustyurt reserves area to 704000 ha 23 of ecological zone was developed ENO was approved by the authorized body report on the positive state ecological appraisal was obtained The feasibility study TEO to expand the reserves area is being developed
field studies on habitation of rare ungulate species of animals between Barsakelmes and Ustyurt PAs were conducted Habitation and animal migration maps were drawn for three routes with total length of 841 km The results of scientific works will be used to establish the proposed ecological corridor

By 2015 coverage of Southern desert in PA system increases by 2682032 ha 89 of the ecological zone This increase comes from the following
Establishment of 1 new PA Mangistau State Reserved Zone covering 2676262 ha
Expansion of 1 existing PA Barsakelmes State Nature Reserve by 5770 ha
By 2020 coverage of Southern desert in PA system increases by approximately 970000 ha 32 of the ecological zone This increase comes from
Expansion of 1 existing PA Ustyurt State Nature Reserve by approximately 220000 ha
Establishment of a wildlife corridor between Barsakelmes and Ustyurt PAs of approximately 750000 ha

1591800 ha 53 of ecological zone as in the baseline
The following activities have been initiatedcompleted by the project to ensure the achievement of the EoP target
Plan of land boundaries allotment for establishment of Mangistau protected area of total area 2600000 ha is being approved by local government akimat of Mangistau Oblast
Works on approval of land use design and feasibility study TEO to expand Barsakelmes reserves area at local government akimat level of Kyzylorda Oblast were performed
dialogue platform was created to openly discuss issues related to adding 23000 ha of the Syrdaria river delta to the Barsakelmes reserve
scientific background report ENO for expansion of the Ustyurt reserves area to 704000 ha 23 of ecological zone was developed ENO was approved by the authorized body report on the positive state ecological appraisal was obtained The feasibility study TEO to expand the reserves area is being developed
field studies on habitation of rare ungulate species of animals between Barsakelmes and Ustyurt PAs were conducted Habitation and animal migration maps were drawn for three routes with total length of 841 km The results of scientific works will be used to establish the proposed ecological corridor

description.narrative: Coverage of underrepresented Mountainvalley subtype desert in the PA System of Kazakhstan

comment.narrative: 99704 ha 33 of ecological zone

By 2015 coverage of Mountainvalley subtype desert in PA system increases by 1602504 ha 534 of the ecological zone This increase comes from the following
Establishment of 1 new PA IleBalkhash State Nature Reserve covering 442296 ha
Expansion of 1 existing PA Altyn Yemel State National Nature Park by 460208 ha
Establishment of a wildlife corridor between Altyn Yemel and IleBalkhash PAs of 700000 ha
By 2020 coverage of Mountainvalley subtype desert in PA system increases by approximately 30000 ha 1 of the ecological zone This increase comes from the following
Establishment of 1 new PA Arganaty covering approximately 30000 ha

99704 ha 33 of ecological zone as in the baseline
The following works have been initiatedcompleted by the project to ensure the achievement of the EoP target
works were performed on land plots of 152000 ha total to establish the IleBalkhash nature reservat The feasibility study TEO was approved by the authorized body report on the positive state ecological appraisal was obtained
Draft Decree of RK Government on expansion of the Altyn Yemel State National Nature Parks area at 146500 ha is being approved by concerned authorities
field studies on habitation of rare ungulate species of animals of Altyn Yemel and IleBalkhash PAs were conducted Habitation and animal migration maps were drawn for three routes with total length of 664 km The results of scientific works will be used for establishment of the proposed ecological corridor
the work on the ENO development for PA establishment in Arganaty plot is being performed The current status of mountainvalley desert ecosystems of the IleBalkhash project area was assessed
Data reported
1Technical economic background report or TEO to establish the IleBalkhash nature reservat
2 Draft Decree of RK Government on expansion of the Altyn Yemel National Park
3 Assessment of wildlife condition and migratory routes

description.narrative: 1. Improved bio-geographic coverage of PA system: by 2020 an additional 5.3 million ha of the least represented desert and semi-desert ecosystems added to the PA estate. 2. Integrated land-use planning under implementation at 9 million ha of desert landscapes, ensuring preservation of ecosystem functions. 3. Demonstration of effective mechanisms and tools for engagement of local communities and other non-PA actors in PA management.

comment.narrative: 1. The current PA system falls short in terms of its bio-geographic representation, with desert ecosystems being currently under-represented. 2. PA design and expansion decisions are not considering the broader, landscape-level processes. 3. Collaborative management in PA governance in Kazakhstan remains a gap.
